h1.strong: School Is Closed Through The School Year

div.p: Click below for COVID-19 Updates, Communications & FAQs

p.strong: Click HERE to view this week's Wildcat Weekly (April 20, 2020 edition). Spanish version HERE.
WOODSIDE SCHOOL (TK-8) & WOODSIDE PRESCHOOL WILL REMAIN CLOSED THROUGH THE SCHOOL YEAR:
p.span: The six Bay Area county school districts, including San Mateo County, and the entire state of California have officially announced the school campus closures through the end of the school year (see press release).
Monday, March 16, San Mateo County Health Officer has extended the SHELTER IN PLACE ORDER for all of San Mateo County until May 3rd. Please read the new Order for specific information.

div.span: DISTANCE LEARNING: Although the Woodside School District and all six Bay Area County School Districts will be closed for in-person instruction, Distance Learning will continue through the end of the school year (June 12). Please read Superintendent's April 20 message to all parents HERE regarding updates to the Distance Learning program for Elementary and Middle Schools.

p.br: As the shelter-in-place order and distance learning continues, we know this may be a difficult time for your family. As a parent, you may be in need of a few helpful (and some fun!) resources to help you get through this Check out our PARENT RESOURCE page HERE — specifically addressing Sheltering-In-Place issues such as — SEL practices, family time, technology/distance learning, establishing daily structure and feeding the family. New links are added regularly.

div.p:
Is Your Child Struggling & Need Support?
Allison Brunner, the School Psychologist, and Mena Lam, the School Counselor created the WESD Counselor's website containing resources for parents, students, and staff including a variety of coping skills, executive functioning strategies, and SEL activities. This website has a virtual "mailbox" to ask a question, share a message, or just contact Ms. Lam or Mrs. Brunner for a check-in. We hope this will provide some additional support with at-home learning. They are here to help your child if he/she is in need of support during this difficult time. Or simply email them directly — Ms. Lam and Mrs. Brunner.

Coronavirus (COVID-19) Updates
To find the most updated information, WESD communications and FAQs regarding Coronavirus (COVID-19), please visit our dedicate website page HERE. Real time updates will still be delivered to all parents via our school's communication system.

2020-21 Registration for NEW Students
Registration for NEW students to the 2020-2021 school year is still open through the campus closure. Please contact Elvira Ramirez Martinez or (650) 851-1571 ext. 4002 to coordinate the registration process.

div.div: Find upcoming and past Woodside School Board meeting agendas HERE.

div.br:
The calendar for the 2020-21 school year is now available HERE! Please be sure to mark down key dates on your own schedule. We strongly encourage scheduling your family travel plans to avoid missing school days.
2020-21 School Calendar

img.alt: Graphic used for No Dogs on Campus

div.br: Especially during our shelter-in-place order, please do not bring your dogs to campus. This is a school policy and signs are posted. We have had a significant problem with dog waste on our fields and campus. It is also important to provide a safe environment for those with allergies and animal fears. Please use our beautiful Woodside trails to walk your dogs.

div.span:
Have a great photo for the website banner?
Send 1920 x 500 pixel, a 300 dpi image
to wildcatsweekly@woodsideschool.us.

div.div: According to Niche.com, our school was rated the #1 Public Elementary School in San Mateo County and our Middle School was rated #4 (out of 2,534) in the Best Public Middle Schools in the state. Our Elementary School Teachers are rated #3 (out of 5,748) and our Middle School Teachers #3 (out of 2,400)! Read for yourself HERE.

figcaption.p: Known for our standards of excellence and rich, balanced curriculum with many opportunities for student success.
A center of educational excellence with a strong focus on the arts and a robust academic program.
Two play-based programs designed to stimulate curiosity and creative expression, promote a lifelong joy of learning and develop a sense of competence.

a.title: Woodside School District Board of Directors
a.alt: Woodside School District Board of Directors

figcaption.p: Everyone is welcome to attend school board meetings and participate in setting policies, goals and objectives for our district.
The mission of the Woodside School Foundation (WSF) is to provide a dependable flow of funds to supplement the budget at Woodside School through the Annual Fund and the Grand Auction.
The PTA plays a huge role in uniting and supporting our teachers and parents through a multitude of programs, events and services.
